metadata.description:
This dataset contains the LAI measurements from the Sidaoqiao in the downstream of the Heihe integrated observatory network from July 26 to October 20 in 2020. The site was located in Ejina Banner in Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. The elevation is 870 m. There are 1 observation samples, around Mixed forest station (101.1335E, 41.9903N), which is about 30 m×30 m in size. Five sub-canopy nodes and one above-canopy node are arranged in each sample. 
The data is obtained from LAINet measurements; the four-steps are performed to obtain LAI: the raw data is light quantum (level 0); the daily LAI can be obtained using the software LAInet (level 1); further the invalid and null values are screened and using the 7 days moving averaged method to obtain the processed LAI (level 2); for the multi LAINet nodes observation, the averaged LAI of the nodes area is the final LAI (level 3).
The released data are the post processed LAI products and stored using *.xls format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Qu et al. (2014) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2020年7月26日至2020年10月20日的黑河水文气象观测网下游混合林站叶面积指数观测数据。站点位于内蒙古额济纳旗四道桥，海拔870 m，下垫面是胡杨与柽柳混合。观测在混合林站（101.1335E, 41.9903N）旁开展，样方大小约30m×30m，每个样方内布设5个冠层下节点和1个冠层上节点。
本数据集由叶面积指数无线传感网（LAINet）获取，该仪器原始观测数据为仪器自动获取的每个节点逐日逐小时的光照数据（Level0），利用LAINet软件对原始观测数据进行处理，逐节点计算每天LAI（Level1），进一步对无效值识别与填充，并7天滑动平均消除天气变化对LAI计算的影响（Level2），对有多个LAINet节点的观测子区，节点的均值为该子区的最终观测值（Level3）。
本次发布的数据集为处理后的Level3产品，数据以*.xlsx格式存储。
黑河流域地表过程综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Qu et al. (2014)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就一直是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013）、咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，以及风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还记录了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to measure leaf area index in mixed forest stands?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个用于测量混合森林林分叶面积指数的数据收集方法的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: The leaf area index in mixed forest stands is measured using a wireless sensor network called LAINet. This method involves automatic data collection of light measurements at various nodes, both below and above the forest canopy, which are then processed to calculate daily leaf area index values.
Example.AnswerCn: 混合森林林分中的叶面积指数通过一种称为LAINet的无线传感器网络进行测量。该方法涉及在森林冠层上下的多个节点自动收集光测量数据，然后处理这些数据以计算每日叶面积指数值。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced in data collection for oasis–desert ecosystems?
Example.QuestionCn: 在收集绿洲–沙漠生态系统数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge in data collection for oasis–desert ecosystems is dealing with the ecological degradation in arid inland river basins, such as the drying up of rivers, degradation of vegetation, and intensified desertification, which complicates long-term environmental monitoring.
Example.AnswerCn: 在数据收集方面，沙漠-绿洲生态系统面临的一个挑战是处理干旱内陆河流流域的生态退化问题，例如河流干涸、植被退化和沙漠化加剧，这使得长期环境监测变得复杂。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you give an example of a dataset that includes energy, water vapor, and carbon flux observations in an oasis–desert area?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个包含绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳通量观测的示例数据集？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of such a dataset comprises long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, along with hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters from the middle and lower reaches of the HRB in western China, available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
Example.AnswerCn: 这样的数据集的一个例子包括来自中国西部HRB中下游的长期能源、水汽和碳通量，以及水文气象、植被和土壤参数，这些数据可从国家西藏高原数据中心获取。

Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域，数据收集面临哪些挑战，以及如何应对这些挑战？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: ecological degradation, drying rivers, vegetation loss, desertification, network of land surface flux and meteorological stations, continuous monitoring of key ecological variables, quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 生态退化、河流干涸、植被损失、荒漠化、地表通量和气象站网络、关键生态变量的持续监测、能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'eddy covariance system' mean in terms of collecting energy and carbon flux data?
Definition.QuestionCn: “涡度协方差系统”在收集能量和碳通量数据方面是什么意思？
Definition.AnswerEn: An 'eddy covariance system' is a method used to measure and analyze turbulent fluxes of energy, water vapor, and carbon dioxide between the surface and the atmosphere. In the context of the field, it involves acquiring half-hourly turbulent flux data to study energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis–desert ecosystems, supporting long-term ecological observations.
Definition.AnswerCn: “涡度协方差系统”是一种用于测量和分析表面与大气之间能量、水蒸气和二氧化碳湍流通量的方法。在这一领域中，它涉及获取半小时的湍流通量数据，以研究绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳的交换，支持长期生态观察。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'oasis–desert system' in environmental and socioeconomic research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 'oasis–desert system' 在环境和社会经济研究中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: The 'oasis–desert system' is significant in research as it plays a crucial role in maintaining ecological stability and agricultural productivity in arid and semi-arid regions. It supports the majority of the population in these areas and is critical for achieving sustainable development goals, particularly in understanding and balancing energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges to protect ecological security and support socioeconomic development.
Definition.AnswerCn: “绿洲-沙漠系统”在研究中具有重要意义，因为它在维持干旱和半干旱地区的生态稳定性和农业生产力方面发挥着关键作用。它支持了这些地区大多数人口的生存，并且对于实现可持续发展目标至关重要，特别是在理解和平衡能量、水汽和碳交换，以保护生态安全和支持社会经济发展方面。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for leaf area index using wireless sensor networks compare to those used for energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis-desert systems?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用无线传感器网络收集叶面积指数的数据方法与用于收集绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳通量的数据方法相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The data collection for leaf area index involves a wireless sensor network (LAINet) that automatically gathers light data at various nodes, while the energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes are collected using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, supplemented by automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 叶面积指数的数据收集涉及一个无线传感器网络（LAINet），该网络在各个节点自动收集光数据，同时使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪收集能量、水蒸气和碳通量，辅以自动气象站收集水文气象数据。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data processing techniques for leaf area index compare to those for energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange datasets in terms of handling environmental variability and data quality control?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 叶面积指数的数据处理技术与能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据集在处理环境变异性和数据质量控制方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Leaf area index data processing involves handling raw light data, calculating daily indices, and applying a 7-day moving average to mitigate weather variability. In contrast, energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange datasets require quality control procedures that include data processing and archiving, addressing different types of environmental variability through a systematic approach.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 叶面积指数数据处理涉及处理原始光数据、计算每日指数，并应用7天移动平均以减轻天气变异性。相比之下，能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据集需要质量控制程序，包括数据处理和归档，通过系统的方法应对不同类型的环境变异性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the main challenges faced in maintaining long-term data collection on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在维持对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的长期数据收集时，面临的主要挑战有哪些？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges include ecological degradation such as drying rivers and vegetation loss, land desertification, and dust storms, particularly in arid regions like those along the Silk Road. These environmental issues can disrupt data collection and affect the stability and reliability of the observations.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 挑战包括生态退化，如河流干涸和植被丧失、土地沙漠化以及尘暴，特别是在丝绸之路沿线的干旱地区。这些环境问题可能会干扰数据收集，并影响观测的稳定性和可靠性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What methodological approaches are essential for ensuring the quality and reliability of hydrometeorological data in inland river basins?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 确保内陆河流域水文气象数据质量和可靠性的必要方法论方法有哪些？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Using automatic weather stations to collect data every 10 minutes and employing a robust quality control procedure that includes data processing, archiving, and sharing are crucial. Supplementary data on vegetation and soil parameters also support the integrity of the dataset.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用自动气象站每10分钟收集数据，并采用健全的质量控制程序，包括数据处理、归档和共享，这些都是至关重要的。关于植被和土壤参数的补充数据也支持数据集的完整性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges of maintaining ecological balance in oasis–desert systems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 维持绿洲-沙漠系统生态平衡的挑战因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological degradation issues such as drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, land desertification, and frequent dust storms, especially in regions along the Silk Road like the Tarim River basin, the Aral Sea basin, and the Lake Urmia basin.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化问题，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化以及频繁的沙尘暴，特别是在丝绸之路沿线的地区，如塔里木河流域、阿拉尔海流域和乌尔米耶湖流域。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it crucial to have long-term observations for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中理解能量、水汽和碳交换需要长期观测？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are essential for quantitatively understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas, which is significant for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and protecting ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于定量理解绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要，这对认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using long-term observational datasets in understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用长期观测数据集来理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using long-term observational datasets allows for a quantitative understanding of the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. This understanding is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions, protecting ecological stability, and supporting socioeconomic development. Long-term data are indispensable for achieving sustainable oasis development and meeting carbon peaking and neutrality goals.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用长期观测数据集可以定量理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征。这种理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠相互作用、保护生态稳定性以及支持社会经济发展至关重要。长期数据对于实现可持续的绿洲发展和满足碳达峰与碳中和目标是不可或缺的。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the presence of ecological environment degradation challenges, like drying rivers and lakes, influence the data collection methods in inland river basins of arid regions?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 生态环境退化挑战的存在，如河流和湖泊干涸，如何影响干旱地区内陆河流流域的数据收集方法？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Ecological degradation challenges such as drying rivers and lakes necessitate a comprehensive and systematic data collection approach that includes hydrometeorological data and vegetation and soil parameters. This approach allows for the monitoring of environmental changes and supports efforts to manage and mitigate the impacts of such degradation in inland river basins.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 生态退化挑战，如河流和湖泊干涸，需要一种全面和系统的数据收集方法，包括水文气象数据以及植被和土壤参数。这种方法可以监测环境变化，并支持管理和减轻内陆河流流域生态退化影响的努力。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What is the primary intention behind collecting and processing leaf area index (LAI) data in mixed forest stations using a wireless sensor network?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在混合森林站点使用无线传感器网络收集和处理叶面积指数（LAI）数据的主要目的是为了什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The primary intention is to understand the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange processes in oasis–desert ecosystems to support ecological stability and sustainable development. The processed LAI data helps achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in these areas.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 主要目的是了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换过程，以支持生态稳定和可持续发展。处理后的叶面积指数（LAI）数据有助于实现这些地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it essential to maintain long-term observations of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中维持能量、水汽和碳交换的长期观测是至关重要的？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial for quantitatively understanding oasis–desert interactions, which significantly impact ecological stability and socioeconomic development. This understanding is key to maintaining the balance between oasis and desert systems for sustainable oasis development.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 长期观察对于定量理解绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，这对生态稳定性和社会经济发展有着显著影响。这种理解对于维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡，以实现可持续的绿洲发展至关重要。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What motivates the integration of hydrometeorological data and vegetation parameters in observational datasets for oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 什么驱动了在绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集中整合水文气象数据和植被参数？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Integrating hydrometeorological data and vegetation parameters aims to comprehensively assess the energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, which are fundamental to protecting ecological security and ensuring sustainable development in arid and semiarid regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 整合水文气象数据和植被参数旨在全面评估能量、水汽和碳通量，这对保护生态安全和确保干旱及半干旱地区的可持续发展至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are the original observational data from a wireless sensor network processed to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the leaf area index measurements?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何处理无线传感器网络中的原始观测数据，以确保叶面积指数测量的准确性和可靠性？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The original observational data, initially in a Level0 format consisting of light intensity data captured hourly at each node, are processed using specialized software to compute daily LAI values (Level1). Invalid values are identified and filled, and a 7-day moving average is employed to mitigate the influence of weather changes on LAI calculations (Level2). For multiple nodes within an observation sub-area, the mean value of the nodes is used as the final observation value (Level3).
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 原始观测数据最初以Level0格式存在，包含每个节点每小时捕获的光强度数据，经过专业软件处理后计算出每日LAI值（Level1）。无效值被识别并填补，同时采用7天移动平均法以减轻天气变化对LAI计算的影响（Level2）。对于观测子区域内的多个节点，使用节点的平均值作为最终观测值（Level3）。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methods are used to integrate auxiliary data, such as vegetation and soil parameters, into the observational datasets of oasis–desert systems?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 用于将辅助数据（如植被和土壤参数）整合到绿洲-沙漠系统的观测数据集中的方法有哪些？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Auxiliary data involving vegetation and soil parameters are integrated into the observational datasets by supplementing the primary data collection process, which includes hydrometeorological and flux data. This integration ensures a comprehensive dataset that supports understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange dynamics in oasis–desert ecosystems.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 辅助数据涉及植被和土壤参数，通过补充主要数据收集过程（包括水文气象和通量数据）整合到观测数据集中。这种整合确保了一个全面的数据集，支持对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换动态的理解。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the comprehensive collection and processing of leaf area index (LAI) data in mixed forest stations within arid regions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在干旱地区的混合森林站点能够全面收集和处理叶面积指数（LAI）数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The use of the Leaf Area Index Wireless Sensor Network (LAINet) enables comprehensive data collection and processing by automatically obtaining light data from multiple nodes every hour. The LAINet software processes this data into daily LAI values, identifies and fills invalid data, and applies a 7-day moving average to mitigate weather variations.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 叶面积指数无线传感器网络（LAINet）的使用使得通过每小时自动从多个节点获取光照数据，实现全面的数据收集和处理。LAINet软件将这些数据处理成每日的LAI值，识别并填补无效数据，并应用7天移动平均法以减轻天气变化的影响。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do long-term observational datasets facilitate the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集如何促进对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets, including energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, alongside auxiliary data on hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, provide a quantitative understanding of ecosystem interactions. These datasets, collected using eddy covariance systems and automatic weather stations, support ecological stability and sustainable development goals.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集，包括能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及关于水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据，提供了对生态系统相互作用的定量理解。这些数据集通过涡度协方差系统和自动气象站收集，支持生态稳定性和可持续发展目标。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What challenges are faced in maintaining data quality and continuity in inland river basins experiencing ecological degradation?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在经历生态退化的内陆河流流域中，维护数据质量和连续性面临哪些挑战？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Inland river basins face challenges such as river and lake drying, vegetation degradation, land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These environmental issues can disrupt data collection and impact the quality and continuity of datasets necessary for understanding ecological processes in arid and semiarid regions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域面临着河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、土地沙漠化以及频繁的沙尘暴等挑战。这些环境问题可能会干扰数据收集，并影响理解干旱和半干旱地区生态过程所需数据集的质量和连续性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might long-term observations be indispensable for understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换是不可或缺的？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial to achieve a quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas. They are significant for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases. This understanding supports the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area, which are critical for ecological security and sustainable development.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于实现对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解至关重要。这对于识别绿洲-沙漠相互作用以及保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。这种理解支持了绿洲-沙漠地区碳达峰和碳中和的目标，这对生态安全和可持续发展至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise when collecting data in inland river basins within arid and semiarid regions?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区收集内陆河流流域的数据时可能会出现哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms. These challenges are especially prevalent in many inland river basins along the Silk Road, adding complexity to data collection efforts in these areas.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的问题，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频繁发生。这些挑战在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域尤为突出，给这些地区的数据收集工作增加了复杂性。

Expectation.QuestionEn: How might data collection methods be adapted to ensure the integrity of datasets comprising energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert systems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 如何调整数据收集方法，以确保包含绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据集的完整性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Data collection methods must involve a rigorous data processing and quality control procedure, which can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. Observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems should include long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters, to maintain the integrity of the datasets.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法必须涉及严格的数据处理和质量控制程序，这可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。从人工和自然绿洲-沙漠系统获得的观测数据集应包括长期的能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据，以维护数据集的完整性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you evaluate the effectiveness of using wireless sensor networks like LAINet for collecting leaf area index data in mixed forest environments?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估在混合森林环境中使用无线传感器网络（如LAINet）收集叶面积指数数据的有效性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The use of wireless sensor networks such as LAINet is highly effective for collecting detailed leaf area index data in mixed forest environments. These networks allow for automated, high-resolution temporal data collection, providing continuous daily and hourly illumination data. This enables more accurate LAI calculation by reducing weather-related variations through processing techniques like 7-day sliding averages. The structured data processing pipeline also ensures the data's reliability and usability.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 无线传感器网络，如LAINet，在混合森林环境中收集详细的叶面积指数（LAI）数据方面非常有效。这些网络允许自动化的高分辨率时间数据收集，提供连续的每日和每小时光照数据。这通过处理技术，如7天滑动平均，减少了天气相关的变化，从而使LAI计算更加准确。结构化的数据处理流程还确保了数据的可靠性和可用性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in maintaining data integrity and accuracy in long-term hydrometeorological observations in arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区维持长期水文气象观测的数据完整性和准确性可能面临哪些挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Long-term hydrometeorological observations in arid regions face challenges such as equipment durability in harsh conditions, data loss due to environmental factors, and the complexities of integrating data from various sources like eddy covariance systems and weather stations. Additionally, ensuring accurate calibration and maintenance of instruments is crucial to maintain data integrity. The variability of arid climates further complicates the interpretation of data, necessitating robust quality control and processing procedures.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区，长期的水文气象观测面临诸多挑战，例如设备在恶劣条件下的耐用性、由于环境因素导致的数据丢失，以及整合来自不同来源（如涡度协方差系统和气象站）数据的复杂性。此外，确保仪器的准确校准和维护对于保持数据的完整性至关重要。干旱气候的变异性进一步复杂化了数据的解读，这需要强有力的质量控制和处理程序。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways could expanding the network of land surface flux and meteorological stations enhance the understanding of oasis–desert ecosystem dynamics?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 扩大地表通量和气象站网络可以通过哪些方式增强对绿洲-沙漠生态系统动态的理解？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Expanding the network of land surface flux and meteorological stations could significantly enhance the understanding of oasis–desert ecosystem dynamics by providing more comprehensive spatial coverage and capturing diverse microclimatic variations. This would allow for a better understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes across different regions, improving the accuracy of ecological and climate models. Additionally, increased data points would facilitate more robust statistical analyses and improve the identification of patterns and trends in ecosystem interactions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 扩展陆地表面通量和气象站网络可以显著增强对绿洲-沙漠生态系统动态的理解，因为这将提供更全面的空间覆盖，并捕捉到多样的微气候变化。这将有助于更好地理解不同区域的能量、水蒸气和碳通量，提高生态和气候模型的准确性。此外，增加的数据点将促进更稳健的统计分析，并改善生态系统相互作用模式和趋势的识别。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how long-term observations can ensure the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白长期观察如何能确保绿洲的生态稳定和社会经济发展。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Long-term observations are crucial for understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. This understanding is significant for achieving the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality and supports the ecological security and sustainable development of oases.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 长期观测对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征至关重要。这种理解对实现碳达峰和碳中和目标具有重要意义，并支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the methods used for observing energy and water vapor exchanges in oasis–desert areas.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在绿洲-沙漠地区观察能量和水汽交换的方法感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Energy and water vapor exchanges in oasis–desert areas are observed using a suite of observational datasets, including long-term energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes. Data are acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer, with additional hydrometeorological data from automatic weather stations.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠地区，利用一系列观测数据集观察能量和水汽的交换，包括长期的能量、水汽、碳和甲烷通量数据。这些数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取，此外还从自动气象站获取额外的水文气象数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of how the data processing and quality control procedures are structured for these observational datasets.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解这些观察性数据集的数据处理和质量控制程序是如何结构化的。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedure is divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing. This structured approach ensures the reliability and accessibility of datasets, which include energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations, supported by auxiliary hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。这种结构化的方法确保了数据集的可靠性和可访问性，这些数据集包括能量、水蒸气和碳交换观测，辅以辅助的水文气象、植被和土壤参数。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please describe the data collection techniques used for observing leaf area index in mixed forest areas within arid regions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请描述在干旱地区混合森林区域观察叶面积指数所使用的数据收集技术。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection for leaf area index in mixed forest areas involves using a wireless sensor network, LAINet, to automatically record light data at each node daily and hourly. Observations are conducted in specific plots with designated canopy nodes, and the data undergo multiple processing stages to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在混合森林区域收集叶面积指数的数据涉及使用无线传感器网络LAINet，自动记录每个节点的光数据，频率为每日和每小时。观察在特定的样地进行，设定了特定的树冠节点，数据经过多个处理阶段以确保准确性和可靠性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explain the challenges faced in collecting and processing long-term hydrometeorological data within oasis–desert ecosystems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，收集和处理长期水文气象数据面临的挑战包括：
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Challenges include ecological degradation such as drying rivers and lakes, vegetation degradation, and desertification. Collecting consistent and accurate data over long periods is difficult due to environmental variability and technical limitations in maintaining and operating measurement instruments in remote and harsh environments.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 挑战包括生态退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化和沙漠化。由于环境变异性和在偏远和恶劣环境中维护和操作测量仪器的技术限制，长期收集一致和准确的数据是困难的。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please outline the key components of a dataset that captures energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 概述一个捕捉绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据集的关键组成部分。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: A comprehensive dataset includes long-term measurements of energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, hydrometeorological data such as radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles, gradients of air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles, and groundwater table data. Vegetation and soil parameters are also essential components of the dataset.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 一个综合数据集包括长期的能量、水蒸气和碳通量测量，水文气象数据，如辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水、土壤湿度剖面以及地下水位数据。植被和土壤参数也是数据集的重要组成部分。
